intro: Tradescantia disgrega, commonly known as the snake plant or mother-in-law's tongue, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its upright, sword-shaped leaves that are often variegated with silver or white markings. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters, typically in shades of white or green. It is a hardy, low-maintenance plant that thrives in well-draining soil and bright, indirect light. Tradescantia disgrega is popular as a houseplant due to its ability to purify indoor air and its adaptability to various growing conditions.
